alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 8:24PM CST until March 16 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Wabash River from Lafayette to Mount Carmel. .Minor flooding is ongoing across central and southern Indiana due to 1.5 to 3 inches of rainfall that fell Friday March 3rd. Flooding is expected to persist well into next week with additional rain expected Thursday night and again this weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, MARCH 16... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Thursday, March 16. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Extensive flooding is in progress. Higher rural roads begin to flood. High water isolates many river cabins. Seep water becomes a problem. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Wednesday /8:00 PM EST Wednesday/ the stage was 19.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Wednesday /8:00 PM EST Wednesday/ was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, March 16. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
